result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maglorio G Santos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maglorio G Santos in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Abbey Marie DeSiato for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT. Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.
Bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety on 03/12/15.
Defense requesting modification of the No Contact order. Court ordered No Contact with A.S. unless approved by Children's Court or BMCW.

Defendant Maglorio G Santos in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia.   Original Information previously filed.  Copy previously given to defense counsel. Defense counsel waives reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests Status Conference. Court granted. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Branch 23.   Case adjourned for an Arraignment Hearing in Branch 23 on 3-5-2015 at 10:00 am.   ADA Abbey Marzick advised of the Substitution of Judge filed by defense counsel.   mld

Defendant Maglorio G Santos in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that due to the assignment of the ADA, this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Br. 4.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM004749  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-31-2015
Court ordered the remaining bail ($1,400.00) to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AS.

Defendant Maglorio G Santos in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kerner, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/15 @ 1:30 pm
